mods.abstract: By the Commanding Officer of the First Regiment of the U.S. Colored Arty. "Heavy." To all who shall see these presents, Greeting: Know Ye That reposing special trust and confidence in the patriotism, valor, fidelity and abilities of Jessie Broyles I do hereby appoint him 7th Corporal in Company "M" of the First Regiment of U.S.C. Arty. (Artillery) (Hvy.) in the service of the United States to rank and as such from the 20th day of November one thousand eight hundred and 64 ..... Given under my hand at the Head Quarters of the Regiment at Greenville, Tennessee this twenty-third day of May in the Year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and 65. Signed by J.E. McGowan (?), Lieutenant Colonel, Commanding the Regiment. Signed by J. Whitset(?), Lieutenant. Jesse Hinton enlisted in the 1st U.S. Colored Heavy Artillery In Knoxville, Tennessee, on October 8, 1864. He enlisted under the name of Jessie (Jesse) Broyles, the surname of his last owner. This document is glued onto the front
